questions.text: Production of which of the following hormones would be most impaired by lesions that affect the pituitary stalk or hypothalamus?

A 45-year-old man reports coarsening of his facial features over several years. In addition, he reports low libido and decreased energy. Physical examination shows frontal bossing and enlarged hands. Which of the following screening tests should be ordered?

A 28-year-old woman presents to the ER with severe headache and vidual disturbances. Head CT revealed a 3cm sellar mass as well as intralesional hyperdensities. On examination, T - 37.5°C, HR 100/min, BP 90/60 mmHg and RR 22 breaths/min. Labs - Na: 132 mEq/L, K: 4.2 mEq/L & Cr: 0.8 mg/dL. What is the next best step in her management?

options.label: C
options.text: Refer for MRI with pituitary protocol.

questions.text: Which of the following is not seen in MEN1?

A 34-year-old man presents to the ER after he was found to be confused by his friend at home. He is alert but disoriented. His friend relays that he was recently fired from his job and has been at home for the last week drinking too much lately. He is afebrile, PR 68/min, BP 140/86 mmHg & has moist mucous membranes with normal CRT and skin turgor. S. Na is 126 mEq/L & CBG is 120 mg/dL. UOSM is 75 mOsm/kg. What is the next step in management?

A 76-year-old woman with a AD and amyloidosis presents to the ER with confusion and lethargy. Her vitals are stable and on examination, she is somnolent but easily arousable, with dry mucous membranes. S. Na is 156 mEq /L with CBG is 140 mg/dL. UOSM is 225 & with a SOSM is 335. IV NS is administered and over the next 12 hours, she voids 1.5 L and repeat S. Na is 154 mEq/L and UOSM is 255 mOsm/kg. dDAVP is administered and UOSM increases to 290 mOsm/kg. What is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: C
options.text: Lack of access to free water.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is false with regards to Klinefelter’s syndrome?

options.label: B
options.text: Patients are at increased risk for breast tumors.

options.label: D
options.text: Most cases are diagnosed after puberty.

questions.text: An elderly man who is a known case of RA is admitted to the hospital after a car accident. CT scan reveals a splenic laceration and emergent splenectomy was performed. In the ICU his BP is 70/50 with an increase only to 82/52 after a bolus of 2 L of NS. Repeat CT scan of the chest, abdomen, and pelvis shows no hemorrhage. Which of the following is the next most appropriate step?
A patient has neurosurgery for a pituitary tumor that requires resection of the gland. Which of the following functions of the adrenal gland will be preserved postoperatively?

options.label: A
options.text: Morning peak of plasma cortisol level.

options.label: B
options.text: Release of cortisol in response to stress.

options.label: C
options.text: Sodium retention in response to hypovolemia.

questions.correct_answer: C. Sodium retention in response to hypovolemia.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Sodium retention in response to hypovolemia.

questions.text: A patient was suspected to have pheochromocytoma was started on labetalol. He has a PMH of depression for which he is taking Sertraline. 24-hour urine total metanephrines are elevated (1.5 x ULN). Which of the following is the next most appropriate step?

options.label: A
options.text: Hold labetalol for 1 week and repeat testing.

options.label: B
options.text: Hold sertraline for 1 week and repeat testing.

questions.correct_answer: A. Hold labetalol for 1 week and repeat testing.
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Hold labetalol for 1 week and repeat testing.

questions.text: Which of the following statements is true regarding management of pheochromocytoma?

options.label: B
options.text: Salt and fluid intake should be restricted.

options.label: C
options.text: IV phentolamine is indicated for HTN crisis.

questions.correct_answer: C. IV phentolamine is indicated for HTN crisis.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. IV phentolamine is indicated for HTN crisis.

questions.text: A 21-year-old woman with a history of type 1 DM is brought to the ER with nausea, vomiting, lethargy, and dehydration. She is confused and not responding to commands. Her BP is 80/40, and HR 112 beats/min. S. Na 126 mEq/L, S. K 4.3 mEq/L, S. Mg 1.2 mEq/L, BUN 76 mg/dL, S. cr 2.2 mg/dL, S. HCO3 10 mEq/L, and S. Cl 88 mEq/L. Serum glucose is 720 mg/dL. All the followingare appropriate management steps EXCEPT:

A morbidly obese diabetic woman was on MF but could not achieve glycemic control. She has had a previous osteoporotic fracture and the patient does not want to take injections. Which of the following would be suitable to reduce her glucose levels?

27-year-old female develops eye pain and reduced visual acuity following the initiation of treatment for her recently diagnosed Grave's disease. Which one of the following treatments is likely to have been started?
Which of the following is NOT associated with pseudohypoparathyroidism?
All of the following is associated with APS type 1, except:
Patients with metabolic syndrome are at higher risk for all of the following EXCEPT:
Which of the following is the recommended daily intake of Ca and vitamin D?
questions.correct_answer: C. 1200 mg calcium, 400 IU vitamin D
questions.explanation: Ans. C. 1200 mg calcium, 400 IU vitamin D.

questions.text: All of the following are risk factors for an osteoporotic fracture in a woman except
A 65-year-old man presents to the clinic with right groin pain that has worsened over the last 6 months. X ray is shown. Which of the following is the underlying cause of the pain?
questions.correct_answer: C. Paget disease and secondary osteoarthritis
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Paget disease and secondary osteoarthritis.

questions.text: 26-year-old guy presented with unconsciousness. Relatives say that he went to a party last night and did not pick their calls since then. ABG?

A 56-year-old obese man was admitted with respiratory failure after pneumonia in the ICU. With time he became more septic and went into septic shock, along with AKI. It was decided that he will need RRT soon and you were asked to get a dialysis catheter. Which of the following statement is true?

options.label: A
options.text: Femoral site is associated with increased risk of infections than jugular vein

options.label: B
options.text: Subclavian vein is preferred due to least complication

options.label: C
options.text: Right jugular vein is preferred over left jugular vein

options.label: D
options.text: The catheter diameter ideally should be about half of the vein diameter

questions.correct_answer: C. Right jugular vein is preferred over left jugular vein
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Right jugular vein is preferred over left jugular vein.

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding acute interstitial nephritis?

options.label: A
options.text: Eosinophilia is noted in approximately 25% of patients with AIN.

options.label: B
options.text: Antibiotics are implicated in 60% of cases of drug-induced AIN.

options.label: C
options.text: 40% of patients taking NSAIDs typically develop nephrotoxicity.

options.label: D
options.text: Renal Ultrasound is diagnostic for AIN.

questions.correct_answer: A. Eosinophilia is noted in approximately 25% of patients with AIN.
questions.explanation: Ans. A. Eosinophilia is noted in approximately 25% of patients with AIN.

questions.text: You are seeing a 20-year-old man who complains of edema and frothy urine for 2 months. Labs reveal a normal serum creatinine and 4+ protein in urine without blood or bacteria. He undergoes a kidney biopsy, which is normal on light microscopy. Which is the best treatment for this patient?
An 11-year-old develops sore throat, fever to 103 F, tender lymphadenopathy, and tonsillar exudate. Which is the 1 st line drug that helps to prevent PSGN ?
In patients with chronic kidney disease, below which degree of renal function does one begin to be at significant risk for 25-hydroxy vitamin D deficiency?

A 42-year-old woman with ESRD due to Ig A nephropathy received deceased donor kidney transplant two weeks ago. She underwent an allograft kidney biopsy due to high creatinine. Biopsy is as below. What should be the best management?
questions.correct_answer: C. Start IVIG+ steroid+ Plasmapheresis± Rituximab.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Start IVIG+ steroid+ Plasmapheresis+_ Rituximab

questions.text: A 15-year-old girl comes to the urologist for a follow-up visit after a UTI. She was diagnosed with B/L grade 4 VUR at the age of four, following frequent UTIs and an episode of pyelonephritis. The patient has been on Abx prophylaxis but had several breakthrough UTIs. Her abdomen is soft and there is no tenderness on palpation. Her BUN is 15 mg/dL and Cr is 1.5 mg/dL. Today a MCU shows left-sided grade 3 VUR and right-sided grade 4 VUR, with no residual postvoid contrast. Which of the following is the best next step in management?

A 65-year-old man with a history of GPA successfully treated with oral CYC presents for evaluation of hematuria. He is asymptomatic and urine protein is 200 mg in 24 hours and he has a stable creatinine of 1.4 mg/dL. ANCA titres are unchanged from baseline. CT scan shows no kidney masses, cysts, or stones. Which one of the following is the next best step in managing this patient?

options.label: B
options.text: Follow up in 6 months with a repeat urinalysis and 24-hour urine protein.

options.label: C
options.text: Start corticosteroids and reassess in 2 weeks.

questions.text: A 34-year-old woman with SLE presents for evaluation. Recent renal Bx showed MGN, and CS were begun. Proteinuria only minimally improved, and Cr stabilized at 1.7. Currently her complaint is B/L flank pain. Urinalysis shows no crystals, 4+ proteinuria, and hematuria. Current Cr is 3.0. Which of the following is the most appropriate initial Rx?

You are reviewing a 33-year-old man who has recently been diagnosed with adult polycystic kidney disease in the renal clinic. You proceed to examine his cardiovascular system. Which other feature are you most likely to find on examination?

options.label: C
options.text: Renal bruit secondary to renal artery stenosis.

questions.text: A 17-year-old female undergoes an uneventful arthroscopic knee surgery on his right knee because of a ligament tear after playing football. The surgery takes a little longer than expected. The next day he has urine like “Coca-Cola.” The patient’s current Cr is 1.7 mg/dL (preop Cr was normal). Exam shows a swollen, tender right leg. Vital are normal. Urine shows dark brown urine with trace protein, 4+ heme, 0 to 2 white blood cells, 0 to 2 red blood cells (RBCs). Which one of the following is the most likely diagnosis?

options.label: D
options.text: Acute obstruction caused by a kidney stone

questions.text: A 70-year-old man with severe PAD is hospitalized for chest pain and undergoes CAG. His serum creatinine is unchanged 3 days post-procedure, but from day 4 slowly rises to a peak of 2.4 mg/dL. Urinalysis demonstrates no proteinuria or red blood cells, and a few granular casts are present. Serum complement is low. Which one of the following is likely?
All of the following statements regarding the condition are true EXCEPT? ​​​​​​​

options.label: A
options.text: Oral calcium supplement may be a risk factor

questions.text: A 59-year-old man has a MI complicated by shock. He recovers well from the MI, but several days later, his renal function deteriorates. One week after his MI, he is oliguric and BUN and Cr are 53 mg/dL and 3.9 mg/dL, respectively. Urinalysis shows multiple granular casts. When measuring the FeNa is likely value is: ​​​​​​​
Which of the following fluid or electrolyte abnormalities can be seen in some patients after the relief of B/L renal obstruction?

A 30-year-old female presents to the ER with epistaxis. On examination, she has a low-grade fever and appears confused and jaundiced. UPT is negative. Blood results from the laboratory: Hb 8.5 g/dl, Platelets 8000/ml, WBC 4500/ml, MCV 92 fl, Na+ 138 mmol/l, K+4.9 mmol/l, Urea 102 mg/dl, Creatinine 3.1 mg/dl, Clotting studies are normal. What is the most appropriate Rx?
‘Fr' in catheter means
Which of the following statements regarding anaphylaxis is false?

options.label: A
options.text: History of atopy is a risk factor for anaphylaxis to penicillin therapy

options.label: B
options.text: Onset of anaphylaxis is within seconds to minutes of antigen exposure

options.label: C
options.text: IV glucocorticoids are NOT effective for acute anaphylaxis

options.label: D
options.text: Failure to use epi within 20 minutes of symptoms is a risk factor for death

questions.correct_answer: A. History of atopy is a risk factor for anaphylaxis to penicillin therapy
questions.explanation: Ans. A. History of atopy is a risk factor for anaphylaxis to penicillin therapy.

questions.text: A 76-year-old woman is brought to ER after getting discharged from recent hospitalization because of right flank and abdominal pain for the past 24 hours. She also has fever and nausea. She has DM2 and on MF. Her temperature is 38.8°C (101.8°F), PR is 92/min, RR 14/min, CBG 127 mg/dL, and BP is 130/82 mm Hg. Urinalysis shows 40-50 s/hpf. Which of the following is the most appropriate Rx for this patient's condition?
What is the immune mechanism leading to organ damage in Goodpasture syndrome? ​​​​​​​
Which of the following is the most likely mechanism of gentamicin related AKI?

A 32-year-old woman with SLE presents with a new cardiac murmur. She has no other symptoms. Echo shows a vegetation on the MV. Which of the following statements is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Blood cultures are unlikely to be positive.

options.label: B
options.text: Glucocorticoid therapy has NOT been proven to be effective.

options.label: D
options.text: The lesion has a high risk of embolization.

questions.correct_answer: C. Pericarditis is frequently present concomitantly.
questions.explanation: Ans. C. Pericarditis is frequently present concomitantly.

questions.text: A 65-year-old man is evaluated for SOB on exertion and dry cough that have worsened over the course of 6 months. He has a H/o CAD, AF and CABG. He has clubbing and his vitals are stable. PFT: FEV1 65%, FVC 67%, FEV1/FVC 74%, TLC 68% and DLCO 62%. Which test is most likely to determine the etiology?
Physician looked at a patient’s CXR and made a diagnosis. His room air SaO2 is 88% & paO2 is 54 mm Hg. Which of the following will improve survival?

A 29-year-old man with CF comes to the ER because of a 1-week H/o worsening, productive cough. Temperature is 39° C (102° F), PR 98/min, RR 21/min, and BP is 129/76 mm Hg. His BMI is 17.5. On examination B/L crackles are heard in the lower lung fields. Chest CT scan shows prominent bronchiectasis. Which of the following antibiotics is the most appropriate next step in therapy of the patient's infection?

A 68-year-old man presents with persistent, productive cough with clear sputum for the past 3 months. He also reports feeling SOB when using the stairs. He is a retired coal miner. His vitals are stable, and examination reveals reduced breath sounds in all lung fields. PFT revealed a FEV1: FVC ratio of 60% and reduced DLCO. Which of the following findings is likely?

35-year-old woman presents with fever and pain in knees and ankles. Her BMI is 21, temperature is 37.8°C (100.1°F), PR 95/min, BP 125/83 mm Hg, RR 14/min, and SpO2 99% on RA. On exam, she has B/L parotid swelling, and she has lesion shown in the picture below. Laboratory studies are normal except for a slightly increased calcium level. What is the most appropriate Rx?

options.label: A
